description.narrative: Policies, strategies and programmes are in place to enhance skills, capacities and resilience of vulnerable adolescents and youth

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policies, strategies and programmes are in place to enhance skills, capacities and resilience of vulnerable adolescents and youth

description.narrative: During 2019, SCO continued working with a number of line-ministries, as no ministry has the overall mandate to work with young people, including the Ministry of Religious Affairs, Ministry of Culture, Ministry of Social Affairs and Labour, Ministry of Local Administration and Environment, the Syrian Commission for Family Affairs and Population, Ministry of Higher Education. Being able to work at policy level to mainstream the young people agenda across ministries was key to ensure programme success, as well as being able to reach a larger number of young people across all governorates in Syria. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of young people mobilized to support collection of data and information to inform policy formulation and advocacy.
Number of implementing partner staff trained.
Number of partners applying the Engagement Monitoring System (EMS)
Number of key duty-bearers from partners (NGO and line ministries) with enhanced capacity to deliver support for adolescent girls and boys and with skills to monitor for quality
Multi-Sectoral National Framework of Action on Adolescent and Youth Development and Participation approved

target.value: 2020:Endorsed multisectoral framewok used to advise formulation of a youth strategy

actual.value: 2019:Action Plan for implementation is endorsed by National Development Committee

title.narrative: Study on youth engagement conducted and report completed.
